before i start the review i need to apologise for my english. its only my 4th language. and still pretty hard for me.

review for those who thinking: is it worth to buy on sale right now or not?

first what i noticed. this game pretty popular and on reddit there are tons of players. but matchmaking taking sometimes 10 (or even more) minuts. for game with crosplatforming its just insane. how hard to find 5 (1 killer and 4 survivors) people in such a popular game?! the game saying that its pretty hard. sometimes its looks like there are only like 10 people who play over and over. and thats it. no more other players. because i played already like 5 games (and yes, every game pretty fast. most of those 6 hours i was waiting for a match) and in those 5 games i seen 1 prearanged team like 2-3 times.

now about matchmaking itself: its rubbish. im as a newplayer in my first game. was thrown as a killer in team of all high grade survivors. that just ended the game like in 4 minuts. and in next 4 games i seen only high level grade players, not one noobie. which is logical to put in first matches at list few noobs aginst me. other noob. but no. all of them had purple high level 4 perks. and bunch of addons. while i had only one first level perk. because to open 3 more slots you need to level up killer to 15 lvl. which isnt too hard. but while you leveling up your hero you would play only wiht pros. who will make you feel yourself miserable. mostly because of: they know map and you dont. sometimes you run to another corner and its just deadend. i wasnt able to do anything because i literally didnt know the map. even with generators was highlighted if you dont know the map you are mostly doomed. and here we go to another con of this game.

before buying i read in bunch of reviews (here on steam) that this game demanding skills from you. and as most reviewers were saying - you need a lot of time to get to this level of skill. and i have to say that its total BS. if you playing other games and good with controller (or with keyboard and mouse) than you will become skilled pretty fast. what is real a huge problem - maps. there are a lot of maps in this game (which is good) but not for noobies. you only starting to learn one map and next game you get totaly different one. and next - another. and next - another. didnt look how many maps there are but it looks like a lot. and to learn them all will take you a lot of time. and before learning all maps prepair to lose a lot. and by losing i mean that survivors literaly will blind you from any corner that you didnt even know that exist. and run in group of four and repair generator almost imidiatly. one by one. 

i literally had not one game when survivors didnt know what they doing. they were just minding there own business like i wasnt even in the game. and again. mosty because they knew how to outrun me because knew the map.

so just only after few hours you will understand that you need at list like 1000 hours in this (for 50 hous on every map) game. just to understand where survivors can run and hide from you. and where you can run and get in dead end. before that it will be pain in ass.

but do i recommend this game? yes. i do. its pretty fun. especially if you have a groupd of 5 friends. in random: prepair to lose a lot. but if you like games that make you feel yourself miserable - you would love it. but as i said - not because its hard skilled base game (how many reviews saying). there are literaly 2 buttons. nothing to learn here. few games with killer you like and you will know the basics. but huge amount of maps will "kiil" you hundreds of time.

Ğ’Ğ¾Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‰ĞµĞ¼ ĞµÑĞ»Ğ¸ Ñƒ Ğ²Ğ°Ñ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ€ Ğ¼ĞµĞ¶Ğ´Ñƒ DBD Ğ¸ Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼-Ñ‚Ğ¾ ĞµÑ‰Ñ‘, Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ±Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ°Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğµ Ğ²Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ²Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ°Ğ½Ñ‚.

A game where enjoyment comes in waves.

At first this game seems extremely daunting; 'there are so many killers, so many survivors, so many maps and so many perks, I don't have time to learn all of this.'

But it all comes in waves.

When you begin playing, the world is against you, your teammates know as little as you, you can't kill the killer so your best bet is to run away and waste his time. As you get better at the game, obviously this becomes easier and easier, knowing where to be and when to be there etc. There is a fair amount of challenge and you may get enjoyment trying to figure out what perks do what and what killers do what and what to do to stop what, it is all a very engaging process.

Then you hit your first wall, if you don't have the best of perks, the best of killers and the best of knowledge, you'll definitely feel stuck, especially at around ranks 6-12 it can feel like you are making no progress at all. You have to put in the extra effort to know which perks are good and why, how to counter killers, how to counter survivors and looping etc.

You pick up steam again, you seem to be the only teammate that knows that they're doing, a very new feeling that will get old very quickly. It is here where enjoyment can stagnate completely, killers or survivors start to abuse the meta/items/addons because it is the only way to maintain high ranks, and it all comes down to RNG.

RNG as to who you're matched with, how good they are, what map you get, how many pallets, what kind of scenery do you have to work with. It is at that point, when the skill ceiling is in view, that the game can become unfair, un-fun, and quite frankly a waste of time, especially with critique from the locals falling on deaf ears, broken mechanics and strategies taking more than enough time to be recognised and fixed, and the occasional toxicity that comes from any multiplayer game.

Overall, it is a very fun game, get one or two friends involved and you have the potential of hundreds of hours of fun and learning to chew through. Give the game a chance, for every easy game there is a hard one, for every long game there is a short one, it is a diamond in the rough for multiplayer survival horror but do keep in mind that it is nowhere near perfect, for now anyways.
